result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan Thomas Daniel Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a HSED during the pendency of probation term.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

supervisions.notes: Good Time Credit to be applied with credit for 82 days of prior time served.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.

Court Costs of $886.00 as to both Counts reimposed and to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan Thomas Daniel Schneider

defendant.name: Schneider, Jordan Thomas Daniel
defendant.address: N1938 County Rd E, Waupaca, WI 54981

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:48 PM: Defendant Jordan Thomas Daniel Schneider in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel admit receipt of Rev Order and Warrant.  No factual corrections offered.  Per DA - Chapter 950 in compliance.   Argument by DA - 4 mos each count - concurrent terms with TS credit of 82 days.  SPD confirms sentencing agreement is a "Joint" recommendation.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts Joint recommendation - 120 days WCJ on each count concurrent to one another with credit of 82 days already served - believes there is 8 days left to serve.  Unfulfilled obligations are to be PIF w/in 60 days subject to contempt order or Payment Plan.  Appeal Rights Given
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 09-29-2015 01:30 pm

Case Called @ 1:33 PM: Defendant Jordan Thomas Daniel Schneider in court, in custody, appearing without counsel.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses status of counsel with Defendant.  Court understood that Def would be eligible for SPD services if Defendant remained in counsel.  Off Record for Def to meet with SPD on eligibility.  Back of Record at 2:52 PM:  SPD confirms eligibility.  SPD requests that plea agreement be enteretained.  Resolution recited by DA.  Plead to Count 1 as will be amended to Misd Level offense and Ct 2 Illegal RX w/o repeater enhancer.  Ct 3 to be DRI and any companion civil citations.  S/W - 2 yrs probation - 7 days TS credit; Ab Sob; AODA and any other terms as deemed appropriate.  Def and counsel concur w/recital.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's Motion to Amend as to Ct 1 to Misd Level POT Plea: GP   Plea to Ct 2 Illegal RX w/o Repeater Enh Plea:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Repeater component attached to Ct 2 dismissed outright.  Ct No 3 DRI as well as 15TR-457 and 15TR-458 also DRI.  Statement by Def: None offered.  The Court:  S/W - 2 yrs probation.  Conditions:   Ct 1 only 7 days cond'l jail with credit for 7 days of TS credit.   Both Counts:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Def to obtain HSED; Court Costs - 60 DTP.  Appeal Rights Given.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:04 p.m. Defendant Jordan Thomas Daniel Schneider in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. DA Blader requesting $1000 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting signature bond. Court orders $1000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
